Pappu Billalu - Evening snack - Andhra Recipe - Indian Savory SnackÂ  Servings - 30 Duration - 45 mins Pappu Billalu are crispy & crunchy tea time / Evening snack. This recipe made out of rice flour is the main ingredient, spices, cumin & sesame seeds, coarse powder of peanuts & roasted chickpea powder and coriander & curry leaves. Anyone who tastes rice flour crackers will definitely like it. Store them in an airtight container and also it tastes good till 20 to 25 days. [caption id="attachment_4295" align="alignnone" width="3264"] Rice flour crackers/ Pappu Billalu ðŸ˜‹[/caption] This is one my favorite Evening snack I like to have it anytime in a day. Kids and family members will surely love this crackers. Nutrition facts : Rice Flour: Vitamin : B6 Minerals : calcium, iron , potassium & magnesium Cumin seeds: Vitamin : A Minerals : calcium, iron , potassium & magnesium Sesame seeds: Vitamin : B6 Minerals : calcium, iron , potassium & magnesium Peanuts : Vitamin : B6 Minerals : calcium, iron , potassium & magnesium Curry leaves: Vitamin : A, B, C, E Minerals : calcium, iron , phosphorus, copper & magnesium Coriander leaves: Vitamins: A & C Today, I prepared rice flour crackers/ Pappu Billalu which are crispy and good taste. Let's start with ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients: 1 cup Â = 160 gmsÂ  Rice flour - 4 cups - 640 gms Peanuts - 120 gms Roasted chickpeas - 60 gms Cumin seeds - 1 tb sp Sesame seeds - 1 tb sp Red chilly powder - 1 & 1/2 tb sp Salt - 3/4th tb sp Hot oil - 2 tb sp Curry leaves - chopped - 1/4 cup Coriander leaves - chopped - 1/2 cup Oil - To deep fry Procedure:
  • Add peanuts in mixer grinder & Make coarse powder
  • Take out in a bowl
  • Add roasted chickpea in mixer grinder & Make coarse powder
  • Take out in a bowl
[caption id="attachment_4319" align="alignnone" width="2448"] Coarse powder of peanuts & roasted chickpea[/caption]  
  • In a deep bowl add rice flour, coarse powder of peanuts and chickpea powder
  • And also add cumin seeds, sesame seeds, salt, red chilly powder, curry leaves & coriander leaves
  • Mix well with spoon
  • Add 2 tb sp hot oil & mix well
  • Make tight & non sticky dough with water
  • I used 2 cups of water and it's enough to make perfect dough
  • Divide dough & make small lemon size balls
  • Apply oil on butter paper & keep a ball
  • Press with tortilla/ use stainless steel press
  • Heat oil over medium heat
  • Drop pressed crackers slowly in hot oil
  • Crackers will float while cooking
  • When they done slowly crackers goes down in the oil
  • It will 4 to 5 mins to cook completely both sides
  • Repeat the same process till the dough completes
  • Take out rice flour crackers on a paper towel to remove excess oil
  • Store in an airtight container
  • Kids will love these crispy rice flour crackers/ Pappu Billalu ðŸ˜€
  • Happy cooking & enjoy your day ðŸ˜Š
Note:
  1. Don't fry them on high heat
  2. Fry 2-3 at a time in oil
  3. Preserve them in an airtight container to remain same taste & crispness of rice flour crackers
  4. Contains peanuts
  5. For best results, cook them in medium heat slowly & carefully
